data.creator: Andre Castillo
data.content: Adam Thielen's homecoming tour is over. Ad On Monday, the Minnesota Vikings announced that they had released the wide receiver after eleven games. He had been a healthy scratch for Sunday's 26-0 blowout loss at the Seahawks. Thanks for the submission! Ari Meirov @MySportsUpdate The #Vikings have released WR Adam Thielen upon is request. Try our NFL Playoff Predictor for real-time simulations and stay ahead of the game! "Following discussions through the weekend and out of respect for Adam, we have agreed to give him the opportunity to pursue more playing time elsewhere. Adam is one of the all-time great Vikings, and we wish him and his family continued success." Ad Thielen himself reacted to the development, promising that he would return one final time to officially retire with the franchise that first signed him as an undrafted free agent in 2013: "As a Minnesota native, putting on this uniform over the years and representing this community both on and off the field has always meant that much more to me. This team is in my bones, it's in my heart and it's part of my DNA. I will ALWAYS be a Minnesota Viking. Ad "Minnesota will always be our home, and we are incredibly grateful to the Wilf family, Kwesi, K. O. and everyone in the Vikings organization for bringing us back in August. This organization means the world to us from the top down and this locker room is filled with true professionals." And there was an outpouring of reactions from fans: Ad Record Message @recordmessage @MySportsUpdate How is your wife feeling about this? She was so excited to go back, celebrating like they won a sb Ad Chief @chiefflips @MySportsUpdate bro saw JJ mccarthy was coming back and said Ad Paw Licka @ThePawLicker @MySportsUpdate Yikes I wonder if they will blow it all up and trade Jefferson to the bills for a 7th round pick Ad Mason Riney @caliking49er17 @MySportsUpdate Future Buffalo Bills WR Ad Jeffro @HarnerJeff74670 @MySportsUpdate He wants no part of that quarterback room. Ad üí±‚Ñ¢Ô∏è @ColdAsDakota @MySportsUpdate Panthers have a chance to do the funniest shit ever Ad Vikings HC Kevin O'Connell gets candid about Adam Thielen's release During his press conference on Monday, Vikings coach Kevin O'Connell was asked about Adam Thielen's departure. He started by reflecting on his appreciation of the player and what he meant to the team, calling him "special": "I just wish him nothing but the best over these final few weeks of the year. Sounds like that might be the final few weeks of his career, and we wanted to make sure, after some dialogue, that we accommodated that." Ad He continued: "Adam's such a good guy. Adam and I talk a lot, there was zero negativity to the conversations. It was more so the competitor in him, and he wants to finish this thing off the right way. He's one of those players that will always hold a spot in my heart." Over ten non-continuous seasons in Minneapolis, Thielen caught 693 passes for 8, 380 yards and 64 touchdowns. He peaked in 2017, being named a second-team All-Pro and Pro Bowler and helping the Vikings reach the NFC Championship Game. √ó Feedback Why did you not like this content? data.title: ‚ÄúThese are smart guys‚Äù - Brad Friedel offers opinion on Neymar joining MLS for reunion with Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez
data.description: Former Premier League goalkeeper Brad Friedel has urged Inter Miami to reunite Lionel Messi and Neymar.
data.creator: Sripad
data.content: Former Premier League goalkeeper Brad Friedel has urged Inter Miami to reunite Lionel Messi and Neymar. He believes that the Brazilian needs to be managed, but can still be a big attraction for the league and the club. Ad Speaking to GOAL, Friedel suggested that Inter Miami should offer Neymar a performance-based contract to ensure they pay him only when he plays. He said the move would help the club and the league, but remains on the fence about it. He said: Thanks for the submission! "If Neymar is fit, then I think it works, I really do because he‚Äôs still a huge name in certain parts of the US. The trouble is if he‚Äôs not fit and he‚Äôs injured a lot, then it becomes a negative media-driven reality. I can understand arguments on both sides for sure. I would assume, and these are smart guys, it would be a tiered contract based on performances and being fit." Ad Trending "Having spent some time in Miami, before Messi came, you wouldn‚Äôt have really known that Miami had a team. From the time that he came, there are pink and black shirts everywhere. If Neymar came, it would add to that. I can understand what they are trying to do. You have to look at it carefully because it‚Äôs a tough one due to his injury record. But he has that special talent that can really excite some American fans. He can do some special things. I would probably be 55 for it and 45 against.‚Äù Ad Neymar is at the end of his contract at Santos and will be a free agent when the season ends. Lionel Messi has extended his deal at Inter Miami, keeping him at the club until 2028. Lionel Messi unsure about Neymar reunion at Inter Miami Lionel Messi was asked by infobae earlier this year if Neymar should make a move to Inter Miami next season, and the Argentine was quick to suggest that he was unsure. He is unsure if the Brazilian would join the MLS side and said: Ad ‚ÄúI don't know. He went through a difficult year, where he was injured for a long time, which leaves him out of the Copa America as well, where he could not play most of the games in Arabia. And now it's difficult. Afterwards, I don't know, the truth is that life takes so many turns that anything can happen, but I don't think that today, no.‚Äù Neymar and Lionel Messi have played 206 matches together at Barcelona and PSG. They have combined for 67 goals in their games together. √ó Feedback Why did you not like this content? data.content: Ellie Goulding is going to be a mom again! The 38-year-old singer was absolutely glowing as she posed for photogs at the The Fashion Awards 2025 Monday, proudly showing off her new baby bump in London. While this will be Ellie's second child -- she shares her 4-year-old son Arthur with estranged husband Caspar Jopling -- it's her first with her new man, 28-year-old actor Beau Minniear, People reports. This comes just months after the couple first went public earlier this year. In July, Beau posted a shot of Ellie nude in bed, and in September, they were snapped on an outing in London. TMZ. com.

data.title: Dec. 8: Call for Entry ‚ÄòPop Culture‚Äô Juried Exhibition Deadline
data.description: Calling all creatives and pop culture lovers, there is one week left to submit to the city of Santa Clarita‚Äôs ‚ÄúPop Culture‚Äù exhibit, which ends Monday, Dec. 8.
data.creator: Press Release
data.content: Calling all creatives and pop culture lovers, there is one week left to submit to the city of Santa Clarita‚Äôs ‚ÄúPop Culture‚Äù exhibit, which ends Monday, Dec. 8. The ‚ÄúPop Culture‚Äù juried exhibition will be on view at the Newhall Community Center from Tuesday, Dec. 16 through March 25, 2026. This exhibition celebrates the icons, imagery and influence of pop culture-inviting artists to explore how entertainment, media, fashion and technology shape collective identity. From nostalgic references to contemporary commentary, ‚ÄúPop Culture‚Äù encourages artists to reflect on the trends, symbols and stories that connect everyone through shared experiences. The exhibition highlights the creative energy of everyday life and celebrates the ways popular culture continues to inspire, challenge and unite everyone through art. Dates and Deadlines Artwork Drop-off: Tuesday, Dec. 16 from noon through 12: 34 p. m. Artwork Pick-up: March 25, 2026 from 11: 30 a. m.- noon. The Newhall Community Center is located at 22421 Market St., Newhall, CA 91321. If artists are unable to pick up their work on the scheduled pick-up date, remaining pieces will be transported to the Arts & Events office in Newhall, where they can be collected at a later time by appointment. The office address is located at 22704 9th St., Newhall, CA 91321. Artists will be notified of juried results one to two days after the deadline. The city‚Äôs Arts and Events reserves the right to change the project timeline. Eligability: All hanging artwork must be properly wired Maximum size 40‚Äù x 50‚Äù (including frame) Maximum weight: 20lbs Artwork previously exhibited with the city will not be considered Mailed artwork will not be accepted Artists must physically hand-deliver and pickup their artwork Per ADA compliance, artwork cannot protrude more than four inches from the wall Acceptable mediums include: Painting, drawing, sculpture, printmaking, photography, textiles and mixed-media. This call is open to artists regardless of race, color, religion, natural origin, gender, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or physical or mental disabilities Each respective artist will be responsible for handling the sale of their own artwork included in this exhibition. The city of Santa Clarita or its employees will not be responsible for the sale of artwork. In the event the city is approached by an interested buyer, the city will provide the interested buyer‚Äôs information to the artist who will then execute the sale of their own artwork. There is no commission due to the city. Celebrating everything that makes pop culture unforgettable: the fashion that defined decades, the shows and games that shaped childhoods, the music that became our soundtrack and the icons who continue to inspire us.

data.title: Pascal Siakam on Pacers: 'We're tired of losing, we can't keep losing, that has to be our mindset'
data.description: Pascal Siakam on Pacers: 'We're tired of losing, we can't keep losing, that has to be our mindset'
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: "You can't take it for granted," Siakam said. "Every single night you go out there, and when you're used to winning you take it for granted. I think every day we go out there, every single possession that we win, every single run that we have, every single win, we gotta take it and enjoy it and know -- which is the most important -- know what it took for us to get to that. We're tired of losing. We can't keep losing. That has to be our mindset. We have to give everything for that." Indianapolis Star.

data.title: "I've always been -- most of the time -- been a part ‚Ä¶
data.description: "I've always been -- most of the time -- been a part ‚Ä¶
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: "I've always been -- most of the time -- been a part of winning, so it's hard," Siakam said after Monday's loss to the Pistons. "It's hard when you're losing. I want to be the best version of myself. I want to be better. I promise you that's the first thing I do every time after the game is over. It's like, 'What can I do better?' 'How can I be better for the team?' Because at the end of the day all I care about is really winning. Just being in a position where you feel like you're not getting the wins, it's hard, it's tough. I have to just have a positive attitude about it, continue to find different ways every single day to be better. That's what it is. I can't run from it." Indianapolis Star.

data.title: PlayStation offering $100 off the Ghost of Yotei PS5, aka my most wanted item, is not the Cyber Monday temptation I need right now
data.description: PlayStation offering $100 off the Ghost of Yotei PS5, aka my most wanted item, is not the Cyber Monday temptation I need right now
data.creator: sam.loveridge@futurenet.com (Sam Loveridge)
data.content: I'm sitting here helping find you some excellent Cyber Monday deals, wearing a Ghost of Yotei hoodie, and then I see this. How dare you tempt me like this, PlayStation, by dropping the price of both special-edition Ghost of Yotei PS5 consoles by $100 in Cyber Monday PS5 deals. I've basically not stopped playing Ghost of Yotei since it came out in October, snatching every free minute I can spare to dive into it's amazing open world with Atsu and her quest for revenge. I'm sorry Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, I love you dearly, but its Ghost of Yotei that takes my award for GOTY this year. If I had any spare cash right now and didn't already have two PS5s, two gaming PCs and numerous other gaming consoles, I would be absolutely buying one of these Ghost of Yotei PS5s. PlayStation Direct has $100 off both the black and gold versions of these stunning limited edition designs, although the gold keeps coming in and out of stock. Should you buy the Limited Edition Ghost of Yotei PS5 console? If you're anything like me and have absolutely fallen in love with both Ghost of Tsushima and now Ghost of Yotei, I honestly believe you deserve one of these. These are both PS5 Slim consoles, complete with disc drive, but with the limited edition designs. At $499, you are essentially paying $50 for the limited edition design. Walmart currently has the standard PS5 Slim for $449, but the usual RRP for the normal slim being $549 and the limited edition ones at $599, this is still an exceptionally good deal for a console design that won't be around forever. See all Cyber Monday deals at Amazon See more PS5 deals at Amazon.

data.title: DC police have been patrolling with National Guard. How long will it last?
data.description: D. C. police have started patrolling city streets with the National Guard, a change in the relationship between local and federal officials in the aftermath of last week's shooting.
data.creator: Scott Gelman
data.content: D. C. police have started patrolling with the National Guard, a change in the relationship between local and federal officials in the aftermath of last week‚Äôs shooting that killed one guard member and left another critically injured. In some instances, officers have already started working directly alongside National Guard members on patrol, according to a D. C. police official who asked not to be named to openly discuss the plans. But it‚Äôs unclear how long the pairing will last. D. C. Police Chief Pamela Smith said the officers working with the guard members may not last beyond this week, NBC Washington reported. The official told WTOP plans for collaboration moving forward are still in the works, but could come before the end of the week. The D. C. officers who are directly working with the National Guard are working in an overtime capacity, the official said, so they‚Äôre not being asked to focus on collaboration with troops at the expense of other day-to-day responsibilities. The D. C. National Guard‚Äôs Joint Task Force said in a statement over email that it will continue to work with D. C. police ‚Äúto ensure the safety of all who live, work, and visit the District.‚Äù Through a spokesperson, D. C. Mayor Muriel Bowser declined to comment on the plans. Last week, The Washington Post first reported plans for D. C. police and the National Guard to patrol together. The step comes days after the shooting near Farragut Square in Downtown D. C. that killed Specialist Sarah Beckstrom, a National Guard member from West Virginia. Officials said Beckstrom died on Thanksgiving Day. Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe, meanwhile, is still in the hospital with critical injuries. The suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, is expected to appear in court once he‚Äôs medically able, according to U. S. Attorney for D. C. Jeanine Pirro‚Äôs office. Lakanwal had been unraveling for years, according to The Associated Press, so much so that a community advocate contacted a refugee organization for assistance, worried that Lakanwal was becoming suicidal. In Afghanistan, Lakanwal worked in a special Afghan Army unit called Zero Unit, backed by the CIA. He came to the U. S. in 2021 through Operation Allies Welcome, which resettled Afghans after the American withdrawal. Last week, The Washington Post reported, D. C. police leaders received an email that said officers will ‚Äúconduct high-visibility patrols with the National Guard and provide assistance as needed.‚Äù The message included the caveat that plans for the collaboration were evolving. National Guard members first arrived in D. C. in August as part of President Donald Trump‚Äôs crime emergency and law enforcement surge. They‚Äôve largely worked on city streets, in parks and Metro stations, without representatives from other law enforcement agencies. During a news conference Monday, Maj. Gen. James Seward, adjutant general of the West Virginia National Guard, said he could not ‚Äúgo into the details‚Äù about future planned operations regarding troops in the District. After Wednesday‚Äôs shooting, Trump requested that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth order 500 more National Guard members to D. C. data.title: I'm A Celebrity star dealt crushing blow as they're forced to instantly leave camp
keywords: celebrity get me out of here
data.description: ITV viewers saw Ant and Dec deliver some news to the camp on Monday night as another person has left I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here!.
data.creator: news@belfastlive.co.uk (Tianna Corbin)
data.content: ITV viewers saw Ant and Dec deliver some news to the camp on Monday night as another person has left I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here! I'm A Celeb: Ant and Dec broadcast live from the studio *Warning: This article contains spoilers for the latest episode of I'm A Celebrity. Get Me Out of Here!* Monday evening saw ITV presenters Ant and Dec enter the camp to announce the third celebrity departure from the series. The presenting pair confirmed that Vogue would be exiting the jungle following the public vote, requiring her immediate departure from the I'm A Celebrity camp. Following the announcement of Vogue's name, fellow campmates were left heartbroken as they bid farewell before the eliminated star sat down with Ant and Dec to discuss her time in the jungle, reports the Daily Star. Previously, ITV audiences have witnessed the departures of Alex Scott and Eddie Kadi from the programme, causing considerable upset amongst the remaining contestants and viewers. Shortly afterwards, viewers flocked to X to express their reactions to the latest elimination from the programme. READ MORE : ITV I'm a Celebrity star Ruby Wax's unusual Loose Women link unveiledREAD MORE : I'm A Celebrity trio spark fury after stealing treats as fans left reeling One viewer commented: "Didn't see Vogue leaving tonight I've got to admit #ImACeleb." Another posted: "Nooooo I'm GUTTED they're getting rid of a woman with a BACKBONE!!!!!!!!" A further fan remarked: "Vogue will be missed." Whilst another audience member posted: "Can't believe Vogue is gone." One individual stated: "Ahhh I liked Vogue!" Whilst another expressed: "Why Vogue? She's a great camper. And yet the British public vote fail again." Overall, Vogue spent 13 days in the camp having been amongst the later arrivals alongside Tom Read Wilson. When questioned about leaving the jungle, she responded: "It feels good I have to say, it was getting really hard and I'm so hungry! But, it's such a weird thing because you kind of want to stay as well. "It's so fun in there, you're just doing so many random things, everyone is such good fun and I'll be sad to leave." Whilst watching clips of her jungle highlights, the 40-year-old disclosed she had overcome her fear of cockroaches following one of the trials. Ant enquired whether she had surprised herself with everything she tackled during her stint. She responded: "I surprised myself, I think that got to us most was the hunger. "I don't think you realise how hungry we are in there, we're absolutely starving and when you do get something it tastes like nothing anyway, it's all mush." The ITV personality shared what struck her most was how keen all the campmates were to participate in the trials when the moment arrived. When questioned about her winner prediction, Vogue informed Ant and Dec that Ruby Wax could be crowned Queen of the jungle.

data.title: 'Demon Slayer: Mugen Train' Returns in New 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray Release
data.description: Crunchyroll announces pre-orders for Demon Slayer: Mugen Train 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray release, including special booklet and bonus content.
data.creator: Erielle Sudario
data.content: It's been five years since Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba The Movie: Mugen Train was released in theaters, making it the highest-grossing Demon Slayer film until the release of Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle. Now, anime fans can relive this fantasy epic in an upcoming physical home release scheduled for next year. Crunchyroll has opened pre-orders for the 4K physical release of Demon Slayer: Mugen Train, scheduled to ship on January 13, 2026. For a listed price of $71. 98, fans will receive a 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray disc of the movie, a special accordion booklet, and promised bonus content. Demon Slayer: Mugen Train adapts the "Mugen Train" arc of the Demon Slayer manga and takes place directly after the events of Season 1. Tanjiro (Zach Aguilar), Nezuko (Abby Trott), Zenitsu (Aleks Le), and Inosuke (Bryce Papenbrook) board the Mugen Train to assist the Flame Hashira, Kyojuro Rengoku (Mark Whitten), in finding a demon on board. But as they continue to board the train, the Demon Slayers fall into deep sleep, thanks to a spell by Lower Rank One, Enmu (Landon McDonald). Demon Slayer: Mugen Train was released in 2020 and has since grossed over $484 million worldwide. It was highly praised by fans and critics on Rotten Tomatoes, earning a 98% Certified Fresh critics score and a 99% Verified Hot Audience score. Additionally, the film won numerous accolades, including "Best Film" at the Crunchyroll Anime Awards and "Animation of the Year" at the Japan Academy Film Prize. How Many Movies Does 'Demon Slayer' Have? Since the anime adaptation of Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaiba premiered in 2019, the Japanese franchise has released two standalone films and two anime compilations. Following the release of Demon Slayer: Mugen Train were Demon Slayer: To the Swordsmith Village and Demon Slayer: To the Hashira Training. The latest release is Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle, the first of three installments of the "Final Battle" Arc, where the Demon Slayer Corps face Muzan and his army in the Infinity Castle. Altogether, Demon Slayer has grossed over $1 billion at the global box office, with Infinity Castle now the franchise's highest-grossing film at over $662 million. The official release dates for the next Demon Slayer films have not yet been announced, and Infinity Castle has no official streaming release date.

data.title: ‚ÄúPresident Trump is Threatening to Kill Me!‚Äù ‚Äì Dem Senator Mark Kelly Goes on Insane Rant During Presser on ‚ÄòPentagon Intimidation‚Äô (VIDEO)
data.description: Democrat Senator Mark Kelly claimed Trump threatened to kill him during a press conference on ‚ÄòPentagon intimidation‚Äô on Monday. The post ‚ÄúPresident Trump is Threatening to Kill Me!‚Äù Dem Senator Mark Kelly Goes on Insane Rant During Presser on ‚ÄòPentagon Intimidation‚Äô (VIDEO) appeared first on The Gateway Pundit.
data.creator: Cristina Laila
data.content: Democrat Senator Mark Kelly claimed Trump threatened to kill him during a press conference on ‚ÄòPentagon intimidation‚Äô on Monday. Mark Kelly is one of the ‚ÄòSeditious Six‚Äô Democrat lawmakers who urged members of the military to defy Trump‚Äôs orders. Last month, without offering any specifics, Senators Elissa Slotkin (D-MI) and Mark Kelly (D-AZ), along with Democrat Reps. Maggie Goodlander (NH), Jason Crow (CO), Chris Deluzio (PA), and Chrissy Houlahan (PA) repeatedly stated, ‚ÄúYou can refuse illegal orders,‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou must refuse illegal orders,‚Äù in a viral video. WATCH: President Trump previously called for the Democrat lawmakers featured in the viral video to be locked up. Trump also said seditious behavior is punishable by death. ‚ÄúSEDITIOUS BEHAVIOR, punishable by DEATH!‚Äù Trump said on Truth Social. The Department of War last Monday announced it is considering recalling Democrat Senator Mark Kelly for court-martial proceedings after he urged the military to defy President Trump‚Äôs orders. Now Mark Kelly is whining about the Pentagon‚Äôs investigation into his seditious statements. ‚ÄúPresident Trump is trying to silence me, threatening to kill me for saying what is true,‚Äù Mark Kelly said in an unhinged rant during Monday‚Äôs presser. WATCH: Full statement from the Pentagon: The Department of War has received serious allegations of misconduct against Captain Mark Kelly, USN (Ret.). In accordance with the Uniform Code of Military Justice, 10 U. S. C. ¬ß 688, and other applicable regulations, a thorough review of these allegations has been initiated to determine further actions, which may include recall to active duty for court-martial proceedings or administrative measures. This matter will be handled in compliance with military law, ensuring due process and impartiality. Further official comments will be limited, to preserve the integrity of the proceedings. The Department of War reminds all individuals that military retirees remain subject to the UCMJ for applicable offenses, and federal laws such as 18 U. S. C. ¬ß 2387 prohibit actions intended to interfere with the loyalty, morale, or good order and discipline of the armed forces. Any violations will be addressed through appropriate legal channels. All servicemembers are reminded that they have a legal obligation under the UCMJ to obey lawful orders and that orders are presumed to be lawful. A servicemember‚Äôs personal philosophy does not justify or excuse the disobedience of an otherwise lawful order.

data.title: Curt Cignetti, Ryan Day share mutual respect ahead of Big Ten Championship
data.description: Indiana‚Äôs and Ohio State‚Äôs respective football coaches spoke well of one another ahead of their teams‚Äô matchup.
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: We‚Äôve come a long way from Curt Cignetti saying Ohio State sucks into a microphone at Assembly Hall. That comment, which included jabs at rival Purdue and Michigan, was made to fire up a home crowd and energize a moribund fanbase immediately after Cignetti‚Äôs hiring in Bloomington. It also served as a way of punching up and a statement on where the Hoosiers‚Äô newest coach would like to take the program. Now, over a year into his tenure, Cignetti is significantly more measured with his words. He‚Äôs explained he felt he needed to create excitement upon his arrival, but now his program‚Äôs status speaks for itself. Cignetti is typically effusive with praise for opposing teams during his pregame press conferences but reserved some of his most glowing comments for Sunday‚Äôs teleconference ahead of No. 2 Indiana‚Äôs Big Ten Football Championship game showdown with No. 1 Ohio State this coming Saturday. Asked about Ohio State during a media teleconference on Sunday, Cignetti had the following to say about his counterpart in Saturday‚Äôs game: ‚ÄúRyan Day is a great coach,‚Äù Cignetti said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be one of the legends of the game someday,‚Äù When Day was asked about this remark later, he responded with praise of his own: ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs quite a compliment,‚Äù Day said. ‚ÄúI appreciate him saying that. Not too sure what to think of that, got a lot of football to coach before any of those types of conversations. Day spoke further on Cignetti‚Äôs upbringing, noting that he grew up in a football family. Cignetti is the son of Frank Cignetti Sr., a longtime former head coach at West Virginia and IUP and has a brother, Frank Cignetti Jr., who‚Äôs coached at the NFL and college levels. He related Cignetti‚Äôs upbringing to his relationship with his own son, R. J. Day, a high school quarterback like Cignetti was. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the son of a coach, and everything that comes with that.‚Äù Day said. ‚ÄúHe just has a feel for the game. When you grow up around this profession, you understand what it‚Äôs supposed to look like, you understand people, you understand situations and that‚Äôs the way he is and that‚Äôs the way he coaches.‚Äù Day noted that Cignetti‚Äôs coaching ability is reflected in how quickly he was able to turn Indiana‚Äôs fortunes around the fact, that he‚Äôs won at each of his stops as a head coach and that members of his staff have stayed with him for so long. ‚ÄúI know people laugh about some of the comments he makes about ‚ÄòGoogle him‚Äô and all that but it‚Äôs true, and he‚Äôs been around football his whole life. It just makes sense to him, he‚Äôs been around it. Been around winning football.‚Äù The Hoosiers and Buckeyes will clash at 8 p. m. ET on Saturday at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.

data.content: If you're looking for a festive gift for a hair styling enthusiast, check out the Shark FlexStyle for $179. 99 at Shark (was $409. 98). I've tested a whole bunch of hair stylers, ranging from ultra-cheap to mega-expensive, and the one I've found myself reaching for the most is the Shark FlexStyle. I thought it was a little overpriced when I first used it, but with this deal it's really incredible value for money. It's rare to find a styler that can do auto-wrap curls (as this one can) for under $200, let alone a great quality option like Shark's. This popular styler is essentially a lightweight, tube-shaped hair dryer with swappable attachments that can be clipped on to create a range of styles. The bundle that's on sale includes auto-wrap curl barrels, a concentrator nozzle, and two brushes one for smoothing and the other for volumizing. Read on for a closer look at the deal, or head to TechRadar's general Cyber Monday deals hub for plenty more discounts on gadgets of all kinds. The best Cyber Monday Shark FlexStyle deal I rate the FlexStyle as one of the best Airwrap dupes around, as well as one of the best hair stylers in general. It feels sturdy and high quality, and the auto-wrap barrels work just as well as the Dyson alternative (although there's no automated curl sequence, you'll have to swap the barrels over when you want to switch the direction of the curl both very acceptable compromises given how much cheaper this version is). The FlexStyle is great as a hair dryer, too: the airflow is powerful, and you can twist the top half of the tube so it sits at a right angle, making the air easy to direct. data.title: BYU Football Sailing Stormy Seas During Big 12 Championship Week
data.description: BYU is 11-1. They play Texas Tech for the right to call themselves champions of the Big 12 Conference this Saturday in Arlington, Texas. If they win, they will be headed to the College Football Playoff to compete for a national championship. Unfortunately, early this week, that feels like a back-page story. Penn State is [.].
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: BYU is 11-1. They play Texas Tech for the right to call themselves champions of the Big 12 Conference this Saturday in Arlington, Texas. If they win, they will be headed to the College Football Playoff to compete for a national championship. Unfortunately, early this week, that feels like a back-page story. Penn State is seriously interested in making BYU head coach Kalani Sitake their new head man in State College. According to multiple reports, the Nittany Lions have an offer on the table for Sitake to jump to the Big 10. Nothing is imminent as of Monday early afternoon. However, this is a situation where there is certainly a fire under the smoke. There is a real chance Sitake deals the massive payday to don a darker shade of blue on the East Coast. He addressed the media Monday morning and gave no details, unsurprinslgy. Per Jacks.. I‚Äôll address it (to the team), but also, they‚Äôre used to me saying, ‚ÄòHey, (coaching rumors are) a good sign that things are going well for us.‚Äù Sitake continued, ‚Äú. We‚Äôre trying to finish the season the right way, it‚Äôs on us to be our best to play against Texas Tech. So as we go through this week and go through the prep, I also want them to live through all the moments and have a great experience and not waste a moment thinking about anything else.‚Äù Sitake is saying all the right things of course, as one would expect. But the rumors are real and the distraction. equally real. Even if the school, the team, and Sitake say they want to avoid distractions heading into one of the biggest football games in BYU history, it‚Äôs too late. The toothpaste is out, there‚Äôs no putting it back in. There is a non-zero chance that BYU will be essentially head coach-less when they take the field at the home of the Dallas Cowboys, competing for a conference championship and a shot at the College Football Playoff. Frankly, that‚Äôs one of the prices of success in the non-SEC-or-Big 10 world. Sitake absolutely deserves a raise, if nothing else. He is 83-44 at BYU since beginning in 2016. Four of the last six seasons have ended in double-digit wins. Beginning in 2023, BYU entered Power Four status in the Big 12. After a rocky first season, the Cougars now have reached 11 wins in back-to-back seasons, going 22-3 since the beginning of 2024. There are very few college football programs who have been more successful than BYU over the last two seasons. It seems like the ball is in BYU‚Äôs court to try and match, or at least compete, with Penn State‚Äôs offer to keep Sitake in Provo. Sitake and his assistants deserve to be well-compensated for their success the last two seasons. With Sitake or not, the Big 12 will host its championship this Saturday. The players and coaches will try and shake off the distractions and prepare for the nation‚Äôs top defense in Texas Tech, and a team set to perhaps earn a bye as a top four team in the College Football Playoff should they beat BYU. Certainly, this is not an ideal start to Conference Championship Week.

data.title: Nigeria's defence minister resigns amid security crisis: presidency
data.description: Nigeria's defence minister resigns amid security crisis: presidency
data.creator: Yahoo News Philippines
data.content: Nigeria's defence minister has resigned, the presidency said on Monday, as the country reeled from a security crisis including mass kidnappings of schoolchildren. The departure of Mohammed Badaru Abubakar came after President Bola Tinubu declared a "nationwide security emergency" last week as the country scrambled to respond to a wave of mass kidnappings that have seen hundreds of people, mostly schoolchildren, captured within days last month. Tinubu's spokesman, Bayo Onanuga, said in a statement that Abubakar, 63, was quitting with immediate effect, on health grounds. "His resignation comes amid President Tinubu's declaration of a national security emergency, with plans to elaborate on its scope in due course," the spokesman said. Africa's most populous country has long experienced insecurity but the spate of abductions recently has left it scrambling. US President Donald Trump in late October named Nigeria a Country of Particular Concern (CPC) -- a State Department designation for religious freedom violations -- over what he called killing of Christians by "radical Islamists". He subsequently threatened to intervene militarily. Washington's rhetoric -- rejected by the Nigerian government and independent security analysts -- has placed the country's security crisis under the spotlight. Armed gangs seized more than 300 teachers and staff at St. Mary's co-education school in north-central Nigeria on November 21. Fifty escaped but the rest are still in captivity. "The children are fine and will be back soon," national security adviser Nuhu Ribadu, was quoted as saying during a high-profile visit with school officials in the town of Kontagora, in central Niger state. Gangs, jihadists Since Boko Haram jihadists kidnapped nearly 300 schoolgirls from the northeastern town of Chibok in an infamous raid more than a decade ago, Nigeria has struggled to contain mass kidnappings. In addition to kidnappings, which are frequent in Nigeria and are mostly carried out by criminal gangs seeking quick ransom payments, Africa's most populous country has been battling a deadly jihadist insurgency in its northwestern regions, since 2009. In the wake of the kidnappings, the country's president declared emergency, and ordered mass recruitment of police and military personnel. Recent raids have resulted in kidnappings of schoolchildren and teachers, worshippers and priests, a bride and her bridemaids, farmers, women and children as well as farmers across various parts of the country. sn/rmb.

data.title: Maxx Crosby continues streak of dominance in loss to Chargers
data.description: Maxx Crosby continues streak of dominance in loss to Chargers
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: The Raiders fell to 2-10 after a 31-14 loss to the Chargers on Sunday where not only did they look outmatched on offense, but consistently struggled on defense as well. A few lone bright spots for the Raiders came with superstar tight end Brock Bowers along with standout pass rusher Maxx Crosby. Crosby started the season slow recording a career low in pass rush win rate along with lows in his sack rate and pressure rate. After a rough few weeks, Crosby seems to be back to form following the bye week with three TFL vs the Jaguars, two vs the Cowboys, and five last week vs the Browns before another four this week vs the Chargers. Additionally, Crosby has registered 4 sacks since the bye week matching his total before which included 2 vs the Chargers. In other ‚Äúadvanced‚Äù metrics, Crosby has seen his run stop win rate over the last five games rise from 36. 8% to 44% which now leads the NFL at EDGE. Crosby also has posted 37 run stop wins in his last five games giving him 93 on the season which is more then 35 than the next closest edge rusher (Rams Jared Verse). As a pass rusher, Crosby saw his win rate rise from 13. 1% before the bye week to 17. 8% currently including three straight games with a win rate over 18%. Despite the Raiders struggles as a defense and in their pass rush situations, Crosby has seen his pressure rate rise as well recording over 22 pressures since the bye week with 7 vs the Cowboys and Chargers. He‚Äôs been a dominant run defender his whole career, though this season the Raiders seem to be getting the best of Crosby in the run game where he‚Äôs on pace to have a career high in run stops, TFL‚Äôs, run defense win rate, and wins. With 5 games remaining on the schedule, the Raiders pass rusher has logged 8 sacks, 59 tackles, 23 TFL‚Äôs, 19 QB Hits, 6 PBU, 49 pressures, 44 stops, and 2 FF putting him just in line with his 2021-2023 dominance before an injury in 2024 outside of his total pressure numbers. With just one more TFL Crosby will break his own franchise record of 23 and he‚Äôs on pace to break 30 TFL for just the 3rd time ever in NFL history.

data.content: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu on Monday held a closed-door meeting with the immediate past Chief of Defence Staff, General Christopher Musa (rtd.) at the State House, Abuja. Musa, who arrived at the State House at exactly 7: 03 p. m., was ushered into the President‚Äôs office wing by a senior security official. The former defence chief made his first public appearance at the State House since his retirement by President Tinubu on October 24, 2025. The agenda of the meeting is yet to be disclosed. General Christopher Musa (rtd.), who met President Bola Ahmed Tinubu behind closed doors on Monday, served as Nigeria‚Äôs Chief of Defence Staff from June 2023 until his retirement on October 24, 2025. His tenure covered a critical period marked by intensified counterterrorism operations, renewed security sector reforms and showcased the current administration‚Äôs ongoing efforts for a unified, whole-of-government security framework in tackling emerging insecurity challenges.

data.title: Tsohon Hafsan Tsaron Najeriya, Irabor Ya Fadi Yan Siyasa Masu Rura Wutar Matsalar Tsaro
data.description: Tsohon babban hafsan tsaron Najeriya, Janar Lucky Irabor ya bayyana cewa wasu yan siyasa na amfani da matsalar tsaro wajen cimma muradunsu na mulki.
data.creator: Legit.ng
data.content: Abuja, Nigeria Tsohon babban hafsan tsaron Najeriya, Janar Lucky Irabor(mai ritaya) ya fallasa 'yan siyasar da yake zargi da rura wutar matsalar tsaro a kasar nan. Janar Irbor ya ce wasu ‚Äôyan siyasa na amfani da rashin tsaro a matsayin makaminsu na neman mulki, har ma suna hura wutar rikice-rikice domin kawao su cimma muradunsu. Ya kuma yi gargadin cewa matsalolin tsaro a Najeriya ta yi girma kuma tana da sarkakiya ta yadda ta zarce a jingina ta ga dalili guda, kamar yadda Vanguard ta kawo. Irabor ya bayyana haka ne a wata tattaunawa da Channels Television a ranar Litinin, inda ya yi cikakken bayani kan nau‚Äôo‚Äôin aikata laifuffuka da ke tayar da tarzoma a kasar nan. Furucinsa na zuwa ne bayan kwanaki kadan da hadimin shugaban kasa, Daniel Bwala, ya ce gwamnatin tarayya na shirin bayyana sunayen wadanda ke daukar nauyin ta‚Äôaddanci. Yayin da yake bayanin rikita-rikitar matsalar tsaro, Irabor ya yi gargadin cewa bai kamala ana dunkule matsala wuri guda a jingina ta ga tushe daya ba. Ya ce Najeriya na fama da nau‚Äôo‚Äôin barazanar tsaro daban-daban, na tsattaauran ra'ayi, na ta‚Äôammali, na siyasa, da na tattalin arziki, kuma duka auna faruwa lokaci guda. Asali: Legit. ng.

data.title: New Aurora City Council members to be sworn in, ushering in liberals‚Äô control
data.description: "We face revenue and other challenges that must be addressed promptly and diligently, and I am prepared to take a strategic approach to them.".
data.creator: Cassandra Ballard, Sentinel Staff Writer
data.content: AURORA | Newly elected and progressive city council members will be sworn in on Monday, and fellow Democrat Councilmember Alison Coombs already has a few suggested changes. The four new Democratic members of city council, Rob Andrews, Alli Jackson, Gianina Horton and Amy Wiles, along with Democratic incumbent Ruben Medina, will all be sworn in Monday for their first night. After that, the city council is slated to take up some procedural changes sponsored by Coombs. The proposals include changing the seating arrangements of council members on the dais, changing the order of some of the events during the meeting, extending and relaxing public listening times to speak and requiring mayoral appointments to boards and commissions to be approved by the majority of city council. The new council members represent a virtual sea change on the dais, giving Democratic progressives control of the city council, where before the election there were only three of board‚Äôs 10 members. Republican incumbents Danielle Jurinsky, Steve Sundberg and Amsalu Kassaw lost their re-election bids. Democrat Crystal Murillo did not run for re-election. Coombs is also the only city council member who submitted an intent to run for Mayor Pro Tem, which will also be decided in Monday‚Äôs meeting. ‚ÄúI am interested in improving collaboration across the city and ensuring we are adequately prepared to handle changes effectively,‚Äù Coombs said in her internet letter. ‚ÄúWe face revenue and other challenges that must be addressed promptly and diligently, and I am prepared to take a strategic approach to them.‚Äù The mayor pro tem designation is significant because that city lawmaker chooses which city council members serve on city council policy committees. The only resolution on the agenda addresses rule changes to the Council Rules of Order regarding ‚ÄúPublic Invited to be Heard,‚Äù ratifying mayoral appointments, the order of the council agenda and seating on the dais, according to city information. The changes to the so-called ‚ÄúPublic Invited to be Heard,‚Äù or the public listening session before the city council meeting which allows members of the public to speak about items that are not on the agenda, include reinstating the session as part of the city council meeting. It was changed during the summer by the conservative majority of city council members, as part of one of many attempts to control disruptions during meetings wrought by protestors. The protests have, for more than a year, been created by family, friends and activists linked to the 2024 police shooting of Kilyn Lewis during his arrest in Aurora. Making the Public Invited to be Heard part of the meeting requires it to be treated like any other agenda items, which also requires city council members to be present and on the dais to listen to the public. If the resolution is approved by city council tonight, it will also extend the Public Invited to be Heard listening session to an hour or longer before the meeting, with an additional hour or longer after the meeting. The public listening session is also moved in the city council rules of order to happen after roll call, the pledge of allegiance, and the adoption of the agenda, and right before the consent calendar. It will also allow speakers to talk for three minutes instead of two. Members of the public who want to speak are now allowed to sign up online before 1 p. m. on the day of the city council meeting, or in person with the city clerk after 5 p. m. and no later than 5: 45 p. m. ‚ÄúThose who sign up after 5: 45 p. m. will be heard in the order they sign up, regardless of proof of residency,‚Äù the proposed changes said. ‚ÄúFor the first Public Invited to be Heard portion of the agenda, sign-ups will be accepted until the time the last speaker finishes speaking. For the last Public Invited to be Heard portion of the agenda, sign-ups will be accepted until the item immediately preceding Public Invited to be Heard is finished.‚Äù The resolution also proposes eliminating the 30-minute limit for public comment for agenda items if city council approves it. There is another clause that says that if the ‚ÄúPublic Invited to be Heard, or any other part of the regular city council meeting becomes disrupted to the extent that it jeopardizes the ability to conduct city business and council decides to move the council meeting to a virtual format, the city manager is directed to order the Aurora Municipal Center closed to the public.‚Äù The resolution also proposes changing the mayor‚Äôs appointment power of city lawmakers to regional boards, commissions and organizations to require ratification by a majority of city council during study sessions. Finally, seating arrangements on the dias could be changed to have city council members with the most seniority in time served as city council members closest to the city attorney and the city manager, and then moving out alphabetically for those who have served the same amount of time. The majority of city council, including the new members, will need to approve the resolution for the changes to happen.

data.title: From Honduras to Poland, Trump meddles in elections as never before
data.description: From Honduras to Poland, Trump meddles in elections as never before
data.creator: Yahoo News Philippines
data.content: The United States has meddled for decades in elections around the world. But no modern president has done so as brazenly as Donald Trump. Forget shady CIA-hatched plots or surreptitious media campaigns. Trump has openly called on other countries' electorates to vote for his right-wing friends, often deploying his favorite tool of social media. Most recently, Trump on his Truth Social platform endorsed Honduran right-wing candidate Nasry Asfura as "the only real friend of Freedom" and vowed to work with him. Asfura held a narrow lead after voting Sunday. "I cannot think of a time when a US president was willing to just openly state his preferences in foreign elections in this way, at least in modern history," said Thomas Carothers, director of the democracy, conflict and governance program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. Trump has felt especially emboldened in Latin America, where the United States has long intervened. Trump's secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has belittled Colombia's elected left-wing president, Gustavo Petro, as a "lunatic," and imposed sanctions on a Brazilian judge who prosecuted former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro for trying to overturn election results. In Argentina, Trump promised $20 billion to prop up the struggling economy but warned it would vanish if voters rejected President Javier Milei in legislative elections. The firebrand libertarian's party ultimately triumphed. "It's a consistent attempt to influence the politics, to reinforce what I think they see as already a shift towards the right that's gaining force across the region," said Will Freeman, a fellow on Latin America at the Council on Foreign Relations. In Venezuela, where there is no election to influence, Trump has suggested the use of US military might to remove leftist leader Nicolas Maduro. Eye on Europe Trump has also sought to tip the scales in Europe. His homeland security chief, Kristi Noem, on a visit to Poland openly endorsed Karol Nawrocki, the conservative candidate for president who went on to win. Trump had less success in Romania, where a far-right ally lost the presidential election, but only after a previous vote was controversially annulled. Vice President JD Vance on a trip to Germany publicly attacked restrictions on the far-right AfD party. Trump or his aides have heaped praise on British anti-migrant lawmaker Nigel Farage and criticized a court ruling in France against far-right leader Marine le Pen. The Trump administration has also stripped back decades of efforts to promote democracy overseas, with Rubio issuing a cable instructing embassies to avoid most commentary on the legitimacy of elections abroad. The stance mirrors Trump's approach to elections at home. He refused to accept his 2020 loss and was charged with trying to overturn results in the state of Georgia -- a case dropped last week in light of his 2024 election victory. Trump, perhaps mindful of his own experience, has publicly urged Israel's president to pardon scandal-tainted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Unique Trump approach Ironically, Trump in a speech in Riyadh in May denounced interventionism, at least in the Middle Eastern context, saying that past US efforts had turned into disasters. Political scientist Dov Levin in a 2021 book found that the United States had intervened in foreign elections more than 80 times since the end of World War II -- more than any other country. Still, Carothers said that Trump was unique not only in his public methods but in his apparent motivations. "It's different than during the Cold War when the United States often favored a particular person, but they did so for geostrategic reasons," he said. "What we have here is more that Donald Trump feels he has a group of friends out there in the world whom he wants to help," he said. Carothers said that only Russia came close in tactics, with the Kremlin weighing in heavily to make known its preferences in former Soviet bloc countries, such as recently in Moldova where its candidate lost. "A very high percentage of European leaders would like to see Viktor Orban lose the next election, but they're not going to say so out loud," he said, referring to Hungary's right-wing populist prime minister. Trump welcomed Orban to the White House last month. Speaking together to reporters, Trump said that European leaders needed to appreciate Orban more. sct-lb/sla.

data.title: Northeast Will Be Colder Than Literally Anywhere Else On Earth, Climatologist Warns
data.description: Northeast Will Be Colder Than Literally Anywhere Else On Earth, Climatologist Warns
data.creator: Andrew Powell
data.content: A powerful blast is forecast to plunge much of the central and eastern United States with some of the planet‚Äôs most extreme cold temperatures right before Christmas, according to a recent forecast. Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) climatologist Judah Cohen forecasts that from the Midwest to the East Coast, temperatures will run 15-20 degrees below normal for much of the second half of December, with the coldest anomalies arriving around the third week of the month. (RELATED: Authorities Issue Winter Storm Alert For Millions As Powerful Nor‚Äôeaster Set To Blast East Coast With Snow, Ice) ‚ÄúMy thinking is that the cold the first week of December is the appetizer and the main course will be in mid-December,‚Äù said Cohen to USA Today. ‚ÄúThe most expansive region of most likely extreme cold on Earth stretches from the Canadian Plains to the US East Coast in the 3rd week of December,‚Äù said Cohen, who cited his weather modeling computer and its discoveries, per the New York Post. The brutal cold will be driven by a major southward plunge of the polar vortex, allowing a massive surge of arctic air to spill across the United States. The exact depth of the cold remains uncertain and will vary by region, but Cohen has expectations that temperatures in most areas will drop below the levels currently being experienced.

data.title: Browns will be without starting guard Wyatt Teller vs. Titans
data.description: The Cleveland Browns have announced that right guard Wyatt Teller will be out against the Tennessee Titans in Week 14.
data.creator: Yahoo Sports
data.content: The Cleveland Browns have announced that starting right guard Wyatt Teller will be out against the Tennessee Titans in Week 14. The news was first reported by Mary Kay Cabot of Cleveland. com. Teller is recently coming off one of his more interesting games of 2025, rotating snaps with backup guard Teven Jenkins due to a coach‚Äôs decision. Now, Teller has been ruled out with a calf injury before the Browns begin their preparations for the upcoming game this Sunday and will be week to week. While the team continues to make these head-scratching moves with one of their most reliable offensive linemen, Teven Jenkins will take all of the snaps at right guard against the Titans. Jenkins was productive for most of the Browns‚Äô preseason in 2025. During the 2024 regular season with the Chicago Bears, he managed to collect a 75. 4 overall PFF grade that ranked 14th among 77 guards in the NFL. A starter for the Bears, he produced this grade in an impressive 738 total snaps played. He also committed only four penalties all of last year, a trend the Browns will need him to continue in order to help ensure success for the offense. After some warm-up reps in Week 13, Jenkins will get the start against a 1-11 Tennessee Titans roster. While they aren‚Äôt expected to bring much pressure to the quarterback, Jenkins and company will need to be well prepared for any disruptions to the offense.

data.title: Seven sign to BGSU softball ahead of 2026 season
data.description: Heading into her second season as head coach, BGSU softball‚Äôs Michelle Gardner announced seven incoming freshman signees to the program. Gardner led the Falcons to their best record in a season since 2022 in 2025, with a 16-6 overall record and seven conference wins in 22 games. The seven listed incomers will join BG in.
data.creator: Ben Corak, Falcon Media Sports Network
data.content: Heading into her second season as head coach, BGSU softball‚Äôs Michelle Gardner announced seven incoming freshman signees to the program. Gardner led the Falcons to their best record in a season since 2022 in 2025, with a 16-6 overall record and seven conference wins in 22 games. The seven listed incomers will join BG in the 2026-27 academic year, meaning they will not play their first season in the spring of 2026, but rather in the spring of 2027. The Falcons landed six freshman signees and a transfer to play in the spring of 2026, stacking seven freshman signees and a transfer on the roster for the 2025 season. Lilly Atkinson- East Troy, Wisconsin/ East Troy High School Atkinson hit for a . 548 batting average and a 1. 691 OPS in her junior high school season in 2025, earning a first-team all-conference selection. In travel ball this summer and fall, Atkinson swung a . 355 batting average with a . 954 OPS as she heads into her senior spring of softball at East Troy H. S. ‚ÄúLilly is a very competitive, strong athlete,‚Äù said Gardner. ‚ÄúShe is a solid outfielder who has a very good arm and great range. Offensively, Lilly hits for average but has power potential as well. I have had the pleasure of watching Lilly grow over the past few years. She has worked very hard to get to the next level, and I look forward to watching her continue to grow with us.‚Äù Maddie Franke- Curtice, Ohio/ Oregon Clay High School Franke earned a selection to the All-Ohio Second Team, All-Northwest District First Team and All-Northern Lakes League Team in the spring of 2025. She plays travel for the Ohio Stingrays and contributes defensively as both a catcher and outfielder. ‚ÄúOffensively, Maddie hits for average but has power potential as well as great speed,‚Äù said Garnder. ‚Äú While watching her over the past year, I‚Äôve grown to appreciate all she brings to the table. She is fast and smart on the field and will help us in many areas. Brooklyn Kemp- Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania/ Upper St. Clair High School A pitcher in her senior year at Upper St. Clair H. S., Kemp has been named to the All-Section Team in three straight seasons, playing travel for Indiana Magic Gold. ‚Äú‚ÄôBK,‚Äô as she is known by her teammates and coaches, has a very calm demeanor on the mound,‚Äù said Garnder. ‚ÄúWhether she is starting a game or going into a tough situation, her presence on the mound never changes; she is out there to do her job. Her ability to keep hitters off balance while facing some of the best players in the country makes her a great addition to our program.‚Äù Mya Lewis- Martinsville, Indiana/ Martinsville High School An infielder, Lewis will play her final season of high school softball at Martinsville in the spring of 2025, finishing her travel career this coming summer with Diamond Dynamics based out of Bloomington, Indiana. ‚ÄúMya is a very athletic player who has the potential to play anywhere in the infield for us,‚Äù Gardner said. ‚ÄúShe hits for average but also has some power potential. I‚Äôve had the pleasure of watching Mya grow as a softball player from the age of 10, when she played with my daughter in Indiana. I knew she would be a great player when she grew older, and I am very excited to have the opportunity to work with her now in college.‚Äù Quinn Loar- Grove City, Ohio/ Grove City High School In her senior season at Grove City H. S., Loar has earned an All-Ohio Capital Conference honor in each of her last two seasons. The catcher also received All-District First Team accolades and plays travel softball for Ohio Lasers Red. Quinn is a very strong athlete who will see time behind the plate but could also see time at first,‚Äù said Gardner. ‚ÄúOffensively, she has power, and we are looking for her to have an immediate impact on our program. Quinn is tough behind the plate and works well with her pitchers. She competes every pitch to help her pitcher, and her ability to win pitches will benefit us greatly. Kadyn Sanchez- Oxnard, California/ Santa Clara High School In her junior season in 2025, Sanchez earned California All-State First Team honors by Cal-HiSports and was also named to the All-CIF Southern Section First Team. The pitcher plays summer softball for the Corona Angels. Kadyn is a strong pitcher who competes against the toughest competition week in and week out in Southern California,‚Äù said Gardner. ‚ÄúShe is a dynamic competitor who is committed to being the best she can be. Kadyn works just as hard in the weight room as she does on the mound, understanding what it takes to be successful at the next level. She brings a mix of speed and movement and is not afraid of any situation.‚Äù Drea Watts- Barboursville, West Virginia/ Cabell Midland High School Watts pitches for Cabell Midland H. S. and was named the West Virginia Gatorade Player of the Year in 2024-25 as just a junior. She was additionally selected as Mountain State Athletic Conference Player of the Year and plays travel for the Ohio Hawks. ‚ÄúDrea is an extremely competitive pitcher who was the West Virginia Gatorade Player of the Year in 2025,‚Äù said Gardner. ‚ÄúDrea has incredible movement on her pitches and commands the zone. She will give a different look from our other pitchers, which will complement our entire pitching staff. Watching her compete this past summer with a broken finger tells me she is tough as nails. She will go through the wall for this program and can make an immediate impact on our program.‚Äù The recruiting class, playing their first season in the spring of 2027, includes three pitchers, two catchers, and an infielder and outfielder. After the upcoming 2026 season, Bowling Green softball will lose an infielder, a utility player, a pitcher, a catcher, and two outfielders, not including possible outgoing transfers. The team‚Äôs first weekend of the regular season will take place in Hampton, Virginia, against Queens and Hampton, a double header on both Feb. 6 and 7.

data.title: Ford CEO Hints At Affordable RWD Performance Sedan
data.description: Jim Farley floats the idea of an affordable EV sedan, while acknowledging that Ford ended the Fusion to fund icons such as the Bronco and Maverick.
data.creator: Michael Gauthier
data.content: Ford‚Äôs future product roadmap has gotten messy as the company has killed or delayed a number of upcoming models. Most of these have been fully electric as the automaker axed their three-row EVs and recently halted F-150 Lightning production at least temporarily. Amid this chaos, Ford isn‚Äôt throwing in the towel on EVs. Quite the opposite as the company is working on a mid-size truck that will be launched in 2027 and ride on the all-new Universal EV Platform. The latter will eventually underpin a ‚Äúfamily of affordable vehicles.‚Äù More: Ford Gives Taurus And Mondeo A Mustang Glow-Up For 2026 That family could include a rear-wheel drive, high-performance sedan that would be affordable. Ford CEO Jim Farley hinted at the car in a recently posted video, which was taken a few months ago at Monterey Car Week. Return of the Sedan? The executive didn‚Äôt say much about it, but implied the mysterious model has a clean silhouette as well as a ‚Äúcool closure‚Äù system in the back, which enables it to carry a lot of stuff. This suggests the car could be a liftback sedan, which would broaden its appeal in the crossover era. Little else is known about the vehicle, but Ford has been hinting at a Mustang sedan since 2022. The company also reportedly showed dealers a rendering in 2024 and this could presumably be what Farley is talking about. Also: This Is An Official Ford Mustang Sedan Sketch And We Love It While that remains unclear, the executive said ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs definitely a market for sedans, a huge market.‚Äù However, he said their previous generations of sedans failed in America because they were built on European platforms to European standards. This resulted in expensive cars, which cost the company a lot of money. Fusion Died So Bronco and Maverick Could Live Farley went on to point out that the Bronco and Maverick never would have happened if they continued making the Fusion. As he explained, they took the money from cars to invest it elsewhere. This has proven to be a wise move and Ford has focused on the ‚Äúsweet zone‚Äù with Broncos, Mustangs, and Raptors. Elsewhere in the interview, Farley shared praise for the Xiaomi SU7. He also talked about his dream of doing an off-road supercar. We‚Äôve covered the latter before, but in this interview he described it as a WRC [World Rally Championship] car for four people as well as something like a Raptor R without a pickup bed. He went on to say the model would be partially electric and have 1, 000 hp (746 kW / 1, 014 PS). Of course, it‚Äôs all just a lot of talk at this point and Ford has been having problems executing their vision. Besides botched EV plans in America, the company‚Äôs European turnaround has stumbled with rebadged VWs. This is on top of 138 recalls and counting.

data.title: Mystery Sonic the Hedgehog spinoff movie coming in 2028
data.description: A fifth Sonic movie is coming is it Shadow the Hedgehog's time to shine, in Paramount's Sonic Universe spinoff?.
data.creator: Michael McWhertor
data.content: Paramount wants to keep the Sonic the Hedgehog movie machine running through 2028: A fifth Sonic movie, which appears to be a spinoff, and not necessarily Sonic the Hedgehog 5, is already on the books, Variety reported Monday. We're already getting Sonic the Hedgehog 4, which has a March 19, 2027 release date and may or may not be titled Sonic CD but Paramount has now committed to a new "Sonic Universe Event Film," for a Dec. 22, 2028 debut in theaters. It's unclear what Paramount plans to do with the Sonic Universe, but after the events of Sonic the Hedgehog 3, which introduced fan-favorite Shadow, a stand-alone movie starring Keanu Reeves' character certainly seems within the realm of possibility (and profitability). Knuckles has already got his spinoff. But there are limitless options when it comes to the Sonic Universe, such as A Big the Cat spinoff, which will be inevitable after Big the Cat is introduced in the live-action/animated hybrid series An adaptation of Mario & Sonic at The Olympic Games, given that the next Olympics will happen in 2028 in Los Angeles and the world will still be in the throes of Olympic Fever Sonic the Hedgehog 4: Episode II, should the dense tome that is Sonic the Hedgehog 4 actually require two movies to tell, and because nothing has ever gone wrong with Sonic the Hedgehog when delivered in episodic form The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog: A Knives Out Mystery, which I think would qualify as a challenge for writer-director Rian Johnson Sonic the Hedgehog 4 promises to be a crowded affair, as the follow-up to Sonic 3 portended the arrival of Amy Rose and Metal Sonic in the live-action Sonic Universe. Should Jim Carrey return as Robotnik, alongside Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, Tom, and Maddie, the film will have quite a few characters to juggle. (So far, no one is officially attached to Sonic 4, even three-time Sonic director Jeff Fowler.).

data.title: Top Trump Adviser Mocked After Boasting About Saving Americans... 19 Cents
data.description: Top Trump Adviser Mocked After Boasting About Saving Americans... 19 Cents
data.creator: Yahoo News Philippines
data.content: President Donald Trump‚Äôs top economic adviser Kevin Hassett drew criticism online this weekend after boasting of a paltry decrease in the cost of turkey this Thanksgiving as evidence of Trump‚Äôs strength in handling the economy. Kevin Hassett, who chairs the White House National Economic Council, suggested that his family‚Äôs Thanksgiving meal was more plentiful than ever this year due to a savings of 19 cents. ‚ÄúTurkey prices were down 19 cents,‚Äù he said in an appearance on ‚ÄúFox & Friends Weekend‚Äù Sunday. ‚ÄúI bought two different ones because some other show was criticizing me because I said, ‚ÄòOh, generic turkeys are pretty good.‚Äô So I made two this time and I didn‚Äôt really notice the difference. So buy the cheaper turkey next year, folks. But you can get the fancy one if you want, too.‚Äù Not surprisingly, Hassett‚Äôs remarks were widely mocked and debated on social media. ‚ÄúOne person‚Äôs grocery receipt isn‚Äôt economic data. National food inflation requires broader metrics than a sample size of two turkeys,‚Äù one person wrote on X. Politics: Economist Pulls Apart Trump‚Äôs Latest Boasts: ‚ÄòMy Kids Don‚Äôt Even Lie That Often‚Äô Added another: ‚Äú‚ÄòI bought 2 turkeys!!‚Äô is not a great response to ‚ÄòAmericans can‚Äôt afford to eat.‚Äô‚Äù It‚Äôs unclear where Hassett had received the 19-cent statistic, or whether he was referring to the total cost of the turkey itself versus the price per pound. However, the Bureau of Labor Statistics Consumer Price Index recently found that food-at-home prices increased by 2. 7% from September 2024 to September 2025. His comments also followed a contentious interview with ABC‚Äôs Jonathan Karl last month in which he defended Trump‚Äôs debunked claim that the overall cost of Thanksgiving dinner this year was less than it was under former President Joe Biden. ‚ÄúYou want us to fix the hole that Joe Biden caused right away,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe prices went up so much under Joe Biden, and inflation is way down.‚Äù Politics: Donald Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄòGross‚Äô Answer To National Guard Member Funeral Question Draws Fury Online Hassett who in 2024 had assets worth at least $7. 6 million, according to Bloomberg ‚Äï is reportedly Trump‚Äôs top pick for the next Federal Reserve chair. The president recently deemed sitting Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell a ‚Äúnumbskull‚Äù for not cutting interest rates quickly enough, while Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said there was ‚Äúa very good chance‚Äù Trump will announce an appointee before Christmas. Related. Trump Toady Makes Bizarre Claim To Justify Thanksgiving Brag We Fact Checked Trump's Latest Gloat Spoiler Alert, It's Wrong Trump Insists He Was Right To Describe Tim Walz With Shocking Slur.

data.title: Driver transporting illegal residents rams police vehicle near Mazmoria Checkpoint
